title: If we had to give a poem another title, what would you suggest? - Quora

response.answer_text: That would depend entirely on the current title of the poem, its message, and content. Humpty-Dumpty sat on a wall Humpty-Dumpty had a great fall All the king’s horses and all the king’s men Couldn’t put Humpty together again While some people might not consider the above a legitimate poem, I do. If I were to rename it (assuming it had a name to begin with), I’d call it Beware of Walls. Or maybe The Failure of Kings. Or how about Horses Need Hands. There are infinite possibilities depending on the imagination of the reader. You need to be more specific in asking questions if you want intelligent answers. Please try again.
